com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.ProxyObject
      • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.events.EventDispatcher
        • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display.DisplayObject
          • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display.InteractiveObject
            • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display.DisplayObjectContainer
              • com.emitrom.flash4j.core.client.display.Loader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IBitmapDrawable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FlexLoader

    public class Loader
extends DisplayObjectContainer
    The Loader class is used to load SWF files or image (JPG, PNG, or GIF) files. Use the load() method to initiate loading. The loaded display object is added as a child of the Loader object. Use the URLLoader class to load text or binary data.

    The Loader class overrides the following methods that it inherits, because a Loader object can only have one child display object the display object that it loads. Calling the following methods throws an exception: addChild(), addChildAt(), removeChild(), removeChildAt(), and setChildIndex(). To remove a loaded display object, you must remove the Loader object from its parent DisplayObjectContainer child array.
